channel.title: How to make this command work properly

item.title: How to make this command work properly
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“xX CoDeR AJ, post:3, topic:396039”]} if (playerCommand.startsWith("task") && c.playerRights >= 0) { c.getSlayer().giveTask(); } else { c.sendMessage("You already have a task, complete it before you get a new one."); c.taskAmount = -1; c.slayerTask = 0;

So like that??[/quote]

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“task”) && c.playerRights >= 0) {
c.getSlayer().giveTask();
} else {
c.sendMessage(“You already have a task, complete it before you get a new one.”);
[code] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“task”) && c.playerRights >= 0) {
c.taskAmount = -1;
c.slayerTask = 0;

[/code]

this would reset it. if you wish to have it state what task you are on just put the slayer task in a sendMessage.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make this command work properly

item.title: How to make this command work properly
item.dc:creator: @xX_CoDeR_AJ xX CoDeR AJ
item.description:
@xX_CoDeR_AJ wrote:

} if (playerCommand.startsWith("task") && c.playerRights >= 0) { c.getSlayer().giveTask(); } else { c.sendMessage("You already have a task, complete it before you get a new one."); c.taskAmount = -1; c.slayerTask = 0;

So like that??

item.title: How to make this command work properly
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

For pi(assuming its pi)

you would use this

c.taskAmount = -1; c.slayerTask = 0;

item.title: How to make this command work properly

item.description:
@xX_CoDeR_AJ wrote:

I want this to give 1 task and if you type it again I want it to say you need to complete blah blah

} if (playerCommand.startsWith("task") && c.playerRights >= 0) { c.getSlayer().giveTask(); }
